title: Two-Thirds of Investors Are Worried About Economic Downturn or Recession
text:
A majority of investors are willing to trade growth opportunities for downside protection, a survey finds. Spencer Platt/Getty Images

Text size

Amid an economic slowdown and heightened market volatility, investors are more concerned about protecting the value of their assets than looking for growth opportunities, according to a survey released by Wilmington Trust Tuesday.

About 61% of investors surveyed with a household income of $225,000 or more say that they would give up growth opportunity for downside protection. And among those who have an annual household income of $500,000 or more, 76% say they would make this trade-off.

The survey polled 500 investors 35 years of age and older with a household income of over $225,000 from Sept. 6-11. The survey will be conducted every six months to keep a pulse of investor confidence, the firm said.
description: The report by Wilmington Trust comes as the firm launches a new investment management brand
